importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Colombia recalled its ambassador to the United States for consultations, indicating a significant escalation in diplomatic tensions during the week of October 20, 2025.
The date when the U.S. recalled its ambassador to Colombia, marking the first major diplomatic incident of the year between the two nations and setting a precedent for the current crisis.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period immediately following a U.S. missile strike on a drug-smuggling vessel in the Caribbean, during which diplomatic tensions between Colombia and the U.S. intensified, culminating in the recall of Colombia's ambassador.

keyTakeAways: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, marking a significant escalation in diplomatic relations.
The recall follows U.S. actions including the deployment of warships in the Caribbean, missile attacks on suspected drug-smuggling vessels, and threats to impose economic sanctions on Colombia.

President Gustavo Petro Urrego of Colombia accused the U.S. of supporting a plot to remove him from power in July, and more recently, President Donald Trump accused Petro of being an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian goods.
Colombia claims that some of the victims on vessels attacked by the U.S. were Colombian citizens, accusing the U.S. of 'murder' and violating sovereignty.
This is the second time this year that Colombia has recalled its ambassador to Washington, indicating deepening distrust and ongoing disputes over drug trafficking and national sovereignty.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, in response to escalating tensions over drug trafficking and U.S. military operations in the Caribbean. The U.S. has conducted missile attacks on seven suspected drug-smuggling vessels, resulting in at least 30 deaths, with Colombia claiming some victims were Colombian citizens. President Gustavo Petro Urrego accused the U.S. of supporting a plot to remove him from power and criticized American actions as acts of 'murder' and violations of sovereignty. In turn, President Donald Trump accused Petro of being an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian goods. This is the second time Colombia has recalled its ambassador to Washington this year, following a similar incident in July when the U.S. recalled its ambassador, indicating a deepening diplomatic rift between the two nations over security, sovereignty, and economic policy.
